content:

{ 

 "manifest_version": 2,  "version": "1.0",  "name": "FF",  "theme": {    "images": {},    "properties": {},    "colors": {      "toolbar": "rgb(91, 92, 93)",      "toolbar_text": "rgb(255, 255, 255)",      "frame": "rgb(37, 38, 38)",      "tab_background_text": "rgb(255, 255, 255)",      "toolbar_field": "rgb(255, 255, 255)",      "toolbar_field_text": "rgb(0, 0, 0)",      "tab_line": "rgb(245, 8, 11)",      "popup": "rgb(255, 255, 255)",      "popup_text": "rgb(0, 0, 0)",      "tab_loading": "rgb(245, 8, 11)"    }  }

title: No captcha display
content: I login facebook and tried to use captcha but no captcha image for selecting anyone can help me fix it?
creator: James061118

title: Immediately on installation of upgrade to FF ver. 90.0 I started having problems with FF.
content:
1. When I have to move another windows across FF, I get a string of repeating images one of the other that I cannot remove until I close that FF page. (See image below)

2. When I save a FF page, it does not close itself. I have to click on the page, refresh it, then I can close it. Also sometimes it take 20-30 seconds to save and close a page that has mostly text on it, such as an article page from one of the many newspapers I review every day including Financial Times, NYTimes, Wash. Post, etc. Due to this and other errors, it slows down my work day to where I am forced to spend one to two extra hours workiing to correct these errors. 

3. When I have FF open, it seems to slow down my entire machine, even though I'm not working at the moment in FF.

4. Please fix this. I work 7-8 hours a day on a project I am nearing 20 years completing. It gets tiresome in and of itself, but when FF causes me more problems it become exasperating and as much as I want to quit, I can't walk away from this project which has grown to nearly 700 gigabytes in size with millions of pages of html, jpg, pdf and txt files.

5. Please help me with a new update that will fix these errors or tell me how I can fix them.

Thank you.
creator: gruff

title: Reload firefox after every reboot on mac
content: I need to reload Firefox from a disk image after every reboot on my mac. This doesn't take much time but its an exercise after every boot up...Need to run the image, punch in credentials and then wait for the sync-up to see all the browsing history and bookmarks...Is there a fix to resolve this challenge?
creator: prashant.chandak

title: Something won't let me input my password.
content:
This seems to be just for Amazon at the moment, but this does not happen on other browsers like Google Chrome.

When I input my password, when I click "login", it changes my password to a long string of encrypted letters, numbers & symbols.

This is just annoying at this point, but, yeah. If anyone has a way to get around this, or disable it somehow, I would be very interested. Thank you!
creator: gizzhead

title: Maximum runned threads
content: I have server with 8 cores 3Ghz and 16 GB RAM. This problem seen on centos 7 and ubuntu 20.04 TLS, firefox 77 If i starting 5-10 screens with firefox in headless mode - all right, this works good for an hours. But if i starting e.x. 20 screens, only ~15-16 of them write data to my own log, other sleeps. All instances stop their work after ~15 seconds (but must working for at least 2 hours) At the same time, not all server resources are exhausted. Tried running with and without --no-remote flag Are there any ideas, how i can run more than 10 browsers?
creator: hacen83490

title: loading my word press site
content: I have just set up my Word Press blog with a new domain name (ldreynolds.com) Firefox won't load it because of various negative security reasons. There is NOTHING WRONG with my site and I want my friends who use Firefox (including myself) to visit my site unhindered. What's up?
creator: ldreynolds

title: Transparent dropdown menus after upgrade to Firefox 90
content:
I just upgraded from FF 89 to FF 90 (on Ubuntu) and the drop down menus (accessed on right-click) are now transparent. I have changed the theme, changed my desktop theme, started FF in troubleshoot mode, disabled acceceration in about:config, and it makes no difference, the menus are still transparent. This makes it difficult to use the browser.

Is this fixable or is it a bug in the latest release?
creator: Psimonics
